normalised: five G Rollout Gains Momentum Across India

unnormalised: New Delhi – India's ambitious 5G rollout is steadily progressing, with major telecom operators substantially expanding their networks across key metros and Tier-II cities. Reliance Jio and Bharti Airtel are leading the charge, aggressively deploying infrastructure and onboarding subscribers to the next-generation network.
normalised: New Delhi – India's ambitious five G rollout is steadily progressing, with major telecom operators substantially expanding their networks across key metros and Tier-II cities. Reliance Jio and Bharti Airtel are leading the charge, aggressively deploying infrastructure and onboarding subscribers to the next-generation network.

unnormalised: The Department of Telecommunications (DoT) reports significant progress in coverage, with substantial areas of Mumbai, Delhi-NCR, and Bengaluru now enjoying 5G connectivity. Experts predict widespread availability by the end of 2024.
normalised: The Department of Telecommunications (D O T) reports significant progress in coverage, with substantial areas of Mumbai, Delhi-N C R, and Bengaluru now enjoying five G connectivity. Experts predict widespread availability by the end of two thousand and twenty four.

unnormalised: The Indian Institute of Technology (IIT) Madras is playing a crucial role in developing indigenous 5G technologies, fostering self-reliance in the telecom sector. Operators are investing heavily, with estimated capital expenditure running into Rs. 3 Lakh Crore over the next two years.
normalised: The Indian Institute of Technology (I I T) Madras is playing a crucial role in developing indigenous five G technologies, fostering self-reliance in the telecom sector. Operators are investing heavily, with estimated capital expenditure running into rupee three lakh crore over the next two years.

unnormalised: However, challenges remain, including spectrum allocation hurdles and the need for enhanced infrastructure in rural areas. Many observers feel the pace is not quite "Rocket Singh: Salesman of the Year" levels, but steady nonetheless. Furthermore, the rollout aims to cover approximately 100,000 km of fiber optic cable deployment to enhance backhaul capacity. Access to affordable 5G handsets also remains a key factor for widespread adoption.
